item.title: Help with ::players command
item.dc:creator: @docarter docarter
item.description:
@docarter wrote:

Let me know if you have an aswer to my question any further off topic flaming will be reported.
[hr]

raped by who:

Please dont double post your topics.

  1. What?
  2. Don’t try and tell me what to do, because i’m not going to listen.
  3. I don’t want your help meaning, you can go find someone else to backseat moderate.
    [hr]

[quote="`Ganon, post:5, topic:294159"][quote author=docarter link=topic=389084.msg2907431#msg2907431 date=1249874600]
I want a quest interface with the names…
[/quote]
Then make one.[/quote]

  1. I have tried, but had an error, and was trying to ask for help when the noobs that don’t even know what java is came, and started asking questions like “What server base are you using?”

If you just want it to show how many players are online then just get the length of the array that holds all the current online players.

item.title: Help with ::players command
item.dc:creator: @docarter docarter
item.description:
@docarter wrote:

I’m using a delta base.

I tried this code:

[code] }
if (command.equals(“players”))
{
int i = 0;
clearQuestInterface();

	for (Player p : players)
	{
		if (p == null || p.disconnected)
		{
			continue;
		}
		sendQuest("" + p.playerName + "", 8147 + i);
		i++;
	}
	sendQuest("Players", 8144);  
	sendQuest("Players online: " + i + "", 8145);
	showInterface(8134);
	flushOutStream();
}

sendQuestSomething(8143);
showInterface(8134);
flushOutStream();
}
[/code]

I’m getting this error:

client.java:7637: cannot find symbol symbol : variable players location: class client for (Player p : players) ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
